The goal of the program is to increase use of modern contraceptive methods by target populations. Target populations include postpartum women, HIV-positive women, adolescents, including Orphans and Other Vulnerable Children (OVCs), medium and high-parity women, post abortion care women, and men/boys, especially with respect to the need for male engagement in FP/RH and gender-based violence. The Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. objectives

The goal of the program is to increase use of modern contraceptive methods by target populations. Target populations include postpartum women, HIV-positive women, adolescents, including Orphans and Other Vulnerable Children (OVCs), medium and high-parity women, post abortion care women, and men/boys, especially with respect to the need for male engagement in FP/RH and gender-based violence. The program is expected to expand the implementation and scale-up of facility and community-based FP services through mobile brigades and community-based distribution of contraceptives to meet the contraceptive needs of the stated populations. The PEPFAR-supported component of this activity will focus on increasing uptake of contraceptives amongst HIV+ women at both the facility and community levels. It is expected that these activities will be implemented nationally providing expertize and TA to the PEPFAR IP and to the Ministry of Health to strengthen FP-HIV integration within HIV service delivery points, particularly in high burden areas of HIV, through training of IP technical staff and supervision as requested and needed. Morever, this mechanism will also focus in three provinces: Nampula, Sofala, Cabo-Delgado. These provinces where selected based on Maternal and Reproductive Health indicators (High fertility Rate, low Contraceptive Prevalence Rate, Family Planning unmet need, High Maternal Mortality Rate), with particular attention to the HIV component in the PEPFAR priority districts. The Family Planning Integrated Project will not work in the same facilities as any PEPFAR Implementing Partner using PEPFAR MTCT funds—including Nampula, given that CDC partners have the clinical lead. Other RH/FP work done in shared facilities will be conducted with non-PEPFAR funds.
